qas.question: When were the prisoners set free?
What sort of prisoners were released?
Who demonstrated close to the Kremlin in July of 1978?
Prior to 1987 when was the last large release of prisoners?
Who released the prisoners in the 1950s?

context: On <a0_0>February 7, 1987,<a0_0/> dozens of <a1_0>political<a1_0/> prisoners were freed in the first group release since <a4_0>Khrushchev's<a4_0/> "thaw" in the <a3_0>mid-1950s.<a3_0/> On May 6, 1987, Pamyat, a Russian nationalist group, held an unsanctioned demonstration in Moscow. The authorities did not break up the demonstration and even kept traffic out of the demonstrators' way while they marched to an impromptu meeting with Boris Yeltsin, head of the Moscow Communist Party and at the time one of Gorbachev's closest allies. On July 25, 1987, 300 <a2_0>Crimean Tatars<a2_0/> staged a noisy demonstration near the Kremlin Wall for several hours, calling for the right to return to their homeland, from which they were deported in 1944; police and soldiers merely looked on.
